oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Is Mycoplasma bovis in Bedding Sand Transmissible to Naive Dairy Calves?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wilson, D. J.
Justice-Allen, A.
Goodell, G.
Baldwin, T. J.
Skirpstunas, R. T.
Cavender, K. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bedding
Mycoplasma bovis
M. bovis
arthritis
pneumonia
septicemia
death
metritis
mastitis
agalactia
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The primary objective was to evaluate the possible transmission of Mycoplasma bovis from positive sand bedding to naive dairy calves. Mycoplasma spp, most commonly M. bovis, can infect calves and adults, causing arthritis, pneumonia, septicemia, or death. Cows may also contract mastitis, metritis, or agalactia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 201
